Title: the fermentation bifurcation

Penny: Oh, hey, if you guys are free this weekend, I won a night of wine tasting from work.
All right, well, let me know if you guys want to go.
Yeah, give her a break from, well, come on.
Hey, are you still hanging out with Bernadette tonight?
No honey baked ham in a hot tub, got it.
Okay, we’re leaving, love you, bye.
Oh. Zack, hi. You guys remember Zack.
E equals MC squared. Yeah. E is for energy, M for mass, and C for the speed of light.
Oh, Leonard mumbles it when he wants sex to last longer.
Uh, you know, I’m not really around that much. Amy knows much more than I do.
Leonard: That sounds fun.
How come scientists don’t win free stuff like salespeople do?
I’m sure that would pair nicely with your fried nuggets of chicken.
The difference is she’s bringing life into the world, and you suck it out.
Sure. I’d like to meet her.
Does this mean Emily’s not in the picture anymore?
Okay, help me out. How are you doing this? Do they know about each other?
Who’s Frank and Alicia?
All right, here goes nothing.
Fine. Preliminary trial of the infinite persistence gyroscopic navigational system, phase one commencing.
Good, it’s not just me.
Hang on.
Oh, I found a scratch-and-sniff book about wine tasting. It teaches the different flavour notes to look for.
I mostly just smell my nasal spray.
Since my preschool got a bunny.
Okay, have fun.
We’re leaving now!
Hey.
Oh, so I shouldn’t ask her how she feels about being a member of your harem?
I smell nothing.
Just a whole lot of Afrin.
Yeah, mm-hmm.
Thanks.
But we won’t bore you with the details.
What’s neat is that they can maintain angular momentum indefinitely.
And I doubt the military would be interested in our little guidance system.
Way better.
I have to admit, I’ve been worried about the military applications since we started talking about this.
Why didn’t you say something?
Would you like a glass of wine?
Maybe we should take a step back.
No, I mean re-evaluate what we’re doing with the guidance system.
What good is money gonna do if we inadvertently bring about Armageddon?
How?
Very funny.
Well, not really.
Not a lot. I just couldn’t start until you walked away.
I don’t think you have anything to worry about. Raj is a terrific guy, loyal to a fault.
Morning.
Ugh. Too much wine.
Hey, did you ever think about the military applications for the guidance system?
Does it bother you?
Who are these people?
Howard: ‘Cause we’re not in it for the stuff. We’re in it for the groupies.
Well, we’re out. Bernie can’t drink ’cause she’s pregnant. And she’s pregnant because we had sex. And we had sex because, well, come on.
You sure?
I bet you’d like a drink right now.
Okay. Everything’s hooked up. We’re ready.
Actually, it’s making me dizzy.
Hey. Where is everybody?
Oh. Cool.
You know, I don’t remember the last time it was just you and me hanging out.
Oh, yeah, and we said we should do it more often. And, and, and, and, and here we are.
I know. What are they gonna talk about?
Oh, good.
No, two minutes.
Where’s Claire?
Really? Nothing?
Yeah, hey, buddy.
We’ve actually been working on a prototype for a navigation system we invented.
Yeah, you know, the boxer who grew a moustache and became a scientist.
Well, we’re using quantum vortices to replace gyroscopes in guidance systems.
You could put it in a satellite or a rocket, and it’ll run forever.
Yeah, but we didn’t create it for weapons.
A lot.
Me, too.
Same reason I don’t talk about ass cancer. It’s not a pleasant topic.
Take a step back? I’m not a young man any more.
But I got a baby on the way. I got to make some money.
Okay, let me stop you right there. We absolutely know our invention will not be used to destroy the world.
Because no one from the future has come back to kill us.
You got something better?
Okay, then. Geez, how much wine did you drink?
Yeah. He still has an AOL address.
Sheldon: Personally, I find the notion of external rewards demeaning. I pursue science for the intrinsic joy of discovery.
I also say don’t contradict me in front of my friends, but that you don’t remember.
Wine again? Yeah, no, thank you. I like my grapes the old-fashioned way, in a juice box.
I shouldn’t have to see my girlfriend get groped in public by another man.
Well, Bernadette, looks like Saturday night, it’s you and me.

Well, it makes perfect sense. Because you’re an expectant mother, you can’t drink alcohol. I don’t like to. You can’t have sushi. I don’t like to. You can’t go in hot tubs. I consider them vats of sweaty people soup.
Oh, come on. Roller coasters, caffeine, runny eggs, I’ve been avoiding these things all my life. And now, because you’re pregnant, you have to.
Well, little lady, you’ve heard of party hearty, get ready to party hardly.
Oh, but I won’t be there.
You know, it’s like how I play Warlords of Ka’a with you and Elder Sign with Frank and Alicia.
You, you and I spend a lot of time together. Can there be a little mystery between us?
I am going to record this for posterity.
Here goes nothing? This is the initial test of our prototype. Can we give it a little more gravitas?
Eh, maybe it’s your voice. I’m gonna see if I can get James Earl Jones to do it in post.
Yes. And we’re going to prove that we don’t need alcohol to enjoy ourselves.
Or caffeine, tobacco, sushi, soft cheese, processed meats and jacuzzis, which can all be harmful to an unborn baby.
Oh, no bubble baths either. They can increase the risk of a urinary tract infection.
Oh, and no swordfish, king mackerel, shark or tilefish, which are all high in mercury.
Oh, and no contact with guinea pigs or hamsters or their droppings, uh, no-no cat litter boxes, no paint fumes.
Boy, do I love restrictions.
Oh, the bubbles tickle my nose. I’ll just open this now so it can get nice and flat before we drink it.

Oh, I have quite the evening planned. Our foetus-friendly festival of fun begins with an in-depth look at the world of model trains, and then we’ll kick things up a notch and explore all the different ways that you can make toast.
You’ve heard of French toast?
Cinnamon toast?
Melba toast?
You get where I’m going here?
H-O gauge trains are 1/87th scale. N gauge are 1/160th scale. And that brings us to Z gauge, at a, you could easily swallow it, don’t ask how I know, 1 to 220.
When I was five, I ingested a Z gauge locomotive. I spent the next three days saying, I think I can pass it, I think I can pass it, I think I can pass it.

What an interesting question. When I was a child, life was confusing and chaotic for me, and trains represented order. I could line them up, categorize them, control them. I guess you could say that they gave me a sense of calm in a world that didn’t.
Well, other than when they’re chugging through your bowels, these things are magic.
And last but not least, this is one that I like to call Star Wars Toast because it has a light side and a dark side. All righty, it’s time for Dungeons & Dragons.
You’re gonna enjoy this. I designed it especially for you.
Oh, I have a feeling that once you start, you’re not gonna want to or be allowed to stop.
Ready?
Your name is Bernatrix. You are a warrior queen. You’re strong, beautiful and tall.
I think you’re gonna like a lot of things I have in store. For example, in this world, only the men get pregnant, so your husband is home trying not to pee when he laughs.
You’re parched and weary from battle. You stand in front of a tavern that serves the coldest, most delicious ale in all the realm.
What do you do?
He wants to see I.D.
The Hell Prawn lunges out of the hot spring. You block it with your shield. Do you attack?
Three giant red ones and they never blink. It’s unsettling.

Good choice. Critical hit. Your sword goes through its eye into its tiny brain. With its final dying gasp, it says, you have reduced me to a pile of sushi. Enjoy me with this packet of soy sauce. It’s low sodium. Aaaah.

Using your sword, you prepare a beautiful sushi dinner. You slip into the hot spring and enjoy the warm water on your aching joints. As you happily close your eyes, you recall the incredible evening you’ve had and notice that your feet and ankles are smaller than they’ve ever been. The end.
Oh, the fun doesn’t stop. You’re still going home with a goodie bag full of toast.

I can understand that. From the moment people realized I was a genius, I’ve been Sheldon the Genius. Although I’ve never really wanted a break from that, so I suppose I don’t understand. Which is ironic ’cause, you know, genius.
You’re welcome. And any time you need a break from being Bernadette the Pregnant, Bernatrix the Warrior Queen is here waiting.
Well, mind you now, that offer’s only good until the third trimester. I can’t risk getting amniotic fluid on my spot.
Morning.
Oh, I overdid it myself last night. Hair of the dog.
Of course.
No, it did at first, but then I talked it through with Frank and Alicia, and they really helped put things into perspective.
Leonard, friends are like toilet paper. It’s good to have extras under the sink.
Amy: But you always say that you want to win a Nobel Prize.
Well, it sounds like a nice night. We should go.
Well, I’m going. You couldn’t stop me from getting a massage at the mall, and you’re not stopping me now.
And I shouldn’t have to see my boyfriend riding on a train for children around the mall.
And now you know why I needed the massage.
Oh, we’re the first ones here.
Yeah. Cool.
Oh, I do. It was three years ago.
So, Sheldon and Bernadette are hanging out.
I don’t know. I really don’t know.
Oh, thank God.
But yes.
Hey, Penny, isn’t that your old boyfriend Zack?
Are you gonna say hi to him?
I’m getting an earthy note.
Hello.
Mike deGrasse Tyson?
It’s true. Even Einstein’s theory of relativity was later applied to the development of nuclear weapons.
How do you know that?
So, Claire, we’ve heard so many wonderful things about you.
Uh, mostly Penny’s heard them.
You just did.
Raj: I would love to. I do enjoy the complexity of an aged Pinot noir.
Hey, you think it’d be okay if I brought Claire to the wine tasting?
Oh, that’s great. I’ve been wanting her to meet you guys, too, so this seems like the perfect opportunity.
Funny how that worked out.
No, I’m still dating her.
They know that we’re not exclusive, and we just don’t ask too many questions.
It’s, it’s beautiful.
Hey, Claire.
Hi, yeah. Um, I was wondering, if you’re free Saturday night, all my friends are going to a wine tasting.
Why would it be too big a step?
Nothing to worry about. People meet people all the time, and it isn’t weird. I met Bon Jovi once, which you’d think might be weird. Turns out, total sweetheart.
Boy, it wasn’t this hard with Bon Jovi. I said you rock, he said, thanks, man, and that was that.
Oh, she’s meeting us here. Hey, guys, do me a favour and don’t ask too many questions about the relationship. We’re just keeping it casual.
Yeah, I know you’re teasing, but watch out for karma.
Hey, while you decide, who was better in bed, big hot Zack or wheezy little Leonard? Neener neener.
Also, uh, cherries?
Hey.
You can’t let this stop you. Almost any scientific advancement can be used for destructive purposes.
Hey, Claire. Good, you’re here. Guys, this is my friend Claire. We’re casually dating, and there’s no need for any further questions about it.
I said no questions.
Zack, this is my friend Claire.
Uh, she’s seeing me.
We’re just keeping it casual.
Hey, dude, you’re killing me with Claire.
I mean, come on, look at you. You’re classically handsome, you’ve got a swimmer’s body. Next to you, I look like me.
Yeah, okay, just do me a favour and stop talking about how great Claire is.
Don’t listen to him. He says crazy things all the time. Uh, watch. Marco.
So, uh, what are you guys talking about?
Why would you do that? I specifically asked you not to do that.
Bernadette: It’s okay, you should go.
Of course.
Me? How? Why?
Gee, Sheldon, I don’t know.
I guess we could give it a try.
I brought sparkling cider.
So what do you want to do tonight?
There’s more than one?
Yeah.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Yeah.
I’m sorry, I have to ask.
What is it about trains that you like so much?
That’s lovely, Sheldon.
Dungeons & Dragons? That sounds about right.
Okay, but just for a little bit.
All right.
You bet.
Oh. I like the idea of being tall.
This is getting fun. What’s next?
Oh, I haven’t had a drink in months.
I storm in, slam my sword down, and say, barkeep, bring me the strongest ale you have and serve it in the skull of a goblin.
Does it have eyes?
I stab it in the middle eye.
Okay, I guess I should eat the Hell Prawn.
Wow, this night turned out to be so much more fun than I thought.
Thank you for this. You know, ever since people found out I’m having a baby, I feel like I became Pregnant Bernadette. It was nice to take a little break tonight.
Well, thanks again.
I might just take you up on that.
Claire: Sure, I guess. If you don’t think meeting your friends is too big a step.
I don’t know. I just don’t want things to get weird.

Okay, but you and I have been keeping things casual. Uh, will you introduce me as your friend or as your girlfriend? What if I like them and they don’t like me? What if they like me and I don’t like them?
So, I got to ask, does Raj bring around other girls?
Your friends were just telling me about all the other girls you’re dating.
Zack: Penny?
Hey, did you two get married?
To each other?
Cool. ‘Cause other than when you broke up with him and dated me, then broke up with me, and then dated me one more time before going back to him, I was always rooting for you two.
So how’s the science world? What are you guys up to?
Are you kidding? I love science. Einstein, Stephen Hawking, Mike deGrasse Tyson.
So what’s your invention?
Angular momentum. I was wondering about that.
Cool. Could it be used for missiles and war stuff?
Is it better than the one they use now?
Huh. You sure you guys are smart?
Boy, you get some dirty looks over there when you ask for ice.
You’re hot. You seeing anybody?
Why’d you say she’s your friend?
Why is he being casual with you? You seem great.
Why are you being casual with her? She seems great.
What are you talking about?
Oh, man, I didn’t mean to do that. But I do appreciate you recognizing my swimmer’s body. Which, incidentally, I got from playing Marco Polo at the YMCA.
Anything for you, my little foreign friend.
I see what you’re saying. She’s not so great.
Polo.
Wow. Maybe none of you guys are smart.
